question: Question_05_(a)
statement:
Consider the curve given by

\begin{align*}\displaystyle y = f(x) = \frac{1}{x^{p}}\end{align*}

for $\displaystyle 1 \leq x \leq B$ where $\displaystyle p,B$ are
constants with $\displaystyle B > 1$ and $\displaystyle p > 0$.

(a) Compute the area of the region between this curve and the
\emph{x}-axis for $\displaystyle 1 \leq x \leq B$. (Later we will refer
to this area as A.)
hints:
The area \emph{A} under the graph of a function \emph{y = f(x)} on the
interval {[}a,b{]} is\\$A = \int_{a}^{b}f(x)dx$

Note the subtlety when \emph{p = 1}, this is a special case that needs
to be treated separately!
